Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: paolamz
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in this nice, modern hotel and I really liked the atmosphere, the level of service, the kindness of the staff, the good restaurant. The only aspect I didnâ€™t appreciate was the room: I booked a standard room and itâ€™s really small. Next time I would surely book a different kind of room. Bathroom was OK. Moreover, the room was a little bit noisy: water flowing in the pipes, elevator.... Their free Wi-fi is working well. Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Friandly and caring”
Reviews.Author: Dominique P
Reviews.Content: For business reasons, I am a regular customer of Divan City Hotel and can say that I feel home when I am back after a long day working. For sure, rooms are not the latest brend new style, but they are clean and cosy + a free and easy access to internet. Dining, breakfast are perfect, tasty, light, generous with additional monthly menu according the seasons. Wine selection can be improved. Fitness is small but enough to restore with access as well to sauna and massages. The staff is perfect, always smiling and helpful and considering you as a special guest. So, overall, a good place to go.

Reviews.Title: “My second home”
Reviews.Author: Zabook
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot to istanbul and divan city is my second home. Great location for business travelers. Breakfast is great and restaurant is perfect for dinner. they have the best Tuna fish salad i have ever ate. Hotel is not new, which means they still have old TV's and shower need a renovation but overall it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “everything fine”
Reviews.Author: Hans M
Reviews.Content: well located, good service enjoyed being there although it was a vfery short trip only

Reviews.Title: “Divan City Hotel is one of the best hotels in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Eroll G
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel staff are very friendly and they always smile which is rare in Istanbul. I will surely come back .

Reviews.Title: “Except the size of the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Laquila
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very convenient to reach many places that you would like to do in Istanbul. With the avalability of taxi and subway, you will be able to stay comfortably for meeting, shopping and sight seeing. The rooms are small but enough for business trips. If you are travelling with your family, it will be better ask for suite. The breakfast is excellent, i recommend you not to lose this chance.

Reviews.Title: “Always best service!”
Reviews.Author: Buketcicek
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel each time I visit Istanbul and each time the experience is extraordinary- great service, fantastic food, comfortable room with all necessities provided, kind and smiling staff, nice location. Wi fi connection is not always strong though. It is always a great pleasure to be a guest in this hotel! I would honestly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business”
Reviews.Author: Jordi S
Reviews.Content: Even is not good located to visit Istanbul as tourist it is closed to business side of city. Good breakfast and free wifi at all hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome..”
Reviews.Author: roundwindow
Reviews.Content: A very warm welcome in perfect English (tesekkuler) and a major room upgrade spontaneously given. Well appointed and comfortable. Others have mentioned tired rooms, mine was fine! All staff very helpful and pleasant. Restaurant good for dÄ±nner and very fairly priced for a hotel of this standard. Great cosmopolitan breakfast selection, from fried eggs to honeycomb and pomegranate seeds. The locatÄ±on cannot be described as pretty and like many/ most hotels in Istanbul it's a taxi ride to most anywhere... but they are cheap and plentiful. Yes, there are more international hotels in Istanbul but I thought this was overall very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and thats all you get”
Reviews.Author: Cigarfreak
Reviews.Content: Excellent location if you would like to be around the MecidiyekÃ¶y and BÃ¼yÃ¼kdere Caddesi area. Dated rooms, plenty of street and hallway noise. Staff not very proffesional. Common areas are okay. Breakfast is good. Not the value of what you pay. You have better options around like the new Point Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: SwennySG
Reviews.Content: There are two Divan hotels, Istanbul (at Europe side). But I managed to guide the taxi driver the right one which located in business/financial district, Mecidiyekoy which facing the busy flyover highway and few metres away from the football stadium. This hotel is ideal for business traveller which metro and bus station is nearby (5-10minutes walk), Cevahir shopping centre (15minutes walk) and Taksim (2 stops by metro). Stayed in junior suite room. Free Wifi and connection is excellent! Living room, bathroom and pantry were pleasant and clean. But the bedroom is small. I keep knocking either on my toes or knee at the edge of the bed or door when Iâ€™m about jump into the bed or take something from wardrobe. Ouch! Sounds proof is average because sometimes you can hear people talking from outside or next room. Breakfast is excellent. Divan chocolate and Turkish delight is very delicious. Staffs are friendly. One point I would like to suggest that the hotel should provide some umbrellas when is rain. The butler is helpful and try to loan/find me an umbrella unfortunately there are only 1 unit for him to use for ushering the guests. Overall I have a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff but below average rooms”
Reviews.Author: hakano
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a unique location and it has nice amenities and friendly staff. However, my room and the bathroom are too tiny. As well, I was expecting to have a non smoking room by default but the smoke smell is prominent in the room. I guess while booking, you have to negotiate non smoking (smelling) room with a nice view. My room's view was really bad. I think the overall quality does not justify the cost of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: fnk1234
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in the business district of Istanbul . Staff is friendly and helpful. Decent size rooms, modern decoration, free wifi. I would recommend this hotel however remember it is right next to a very busy highway and far away from main turist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “An arrogant place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: acece
Reviews.Content: It was really a good and arrogant hotel to stay at the very heart of the Ä°stanbul. Clean, valuable and close enough to attractions of the city. Specially good for business. Definitely recommended. But it is better to stay a room at the backside of the hotel since the front side is very very noisy...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: hellastraveller
Reviews.Content: Welcoming hotel and staff! Only things we were not happy with was how nosy the location of the hotel is and the lighting in our room. Too dark, not efficient. Breakfast menu can be improved. The staff is extremely helpful, friendly, attentive and always smiling.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing atmosphere in business district”
Reviews.Author: Gardenia014
Reviews.Content: I've recently stayed at the Divan City for 2 nights. Somewhat far from the tourist attractions but the hotel itself makes up for that. All the staff are extremely friendly and helpful, thus contributing significantly to the quality of our stay. Rooms are well-designed, comfortable and very clean. The lobby area is very modern and airy, and has a pleasant atmosphere. Rates are reasonable for the quality of the rooms and the serivces. Ideal for business travellers, leisure travellers might want a hotel closer to the main sites even though the metro station is situated closeby.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this very much!!”
Reviews.Author: xiv
Reviews.Content: The hotel was like a cool oasis, in this big, noisy crowded city. I stayed there for 9 days in august 2009, during a study at Bumed university . The rooms were big, modern, stylish, clean, quiet with a big comfy bed. The wireless internet functioned well, so there was no problem with that any time a day. The bathroom and equipment was lovely, which was a positive surprise for me. The breakfast (which was included in the price 110 euro/night) was delicious, but the restaurant was very cold, very much too cold actually. But I learned to dress warm for breakfast. There was a nice gym in the basement, with instructors (!), and they were so "cute", and brought dry towels and good advices all the time. A glass of wine in the bar was really expensive, but it wasn't easy to get wine at the restaurants we ate in, so we became regulars for one glass in the bar every night...... (one glass of wine was about the same price as a full diner in town) The hotel is located in the finacial part of the city, so it took loathes of time to go in to the old citycenter, but it took very much time to move anywhere in this town. I never felt safe or secure out in the streets, but I felt very comfortable at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “There are better choices”
Reviews.Author: HaliTT
Reviews.Content: I've stayed this hotel only for one night. Hotel is in a business district called Mecidiyekoy. Just near the stadium of Galatasaray football team. There's a lot of traffic, so even that the glasses are very thick. You can hear the noise coming from the street. Rooms are not very big. I think this hotel doesn't suit with the Divan Hotels quality.

Reviews.Title: “Fine business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prebber
Reviews.Content: Have stayed several times at the Divan City Hotel and will also return the next time I am in Istanbul as it is clean, effiecient and close to business contacts. As stated in other reviews, the hotel is situated in the financial district of Istanbul so there are no historic or cultural sites close by. Furthermore it is right next to a very high-traffic road so I would not recommend this hotel to tourists looking for a nice, cosy place to stay for a holiday. That said, the hotel works very well. The staff are very good, the breakfast great, the basement gym is very adequate for my needs and the overall chic and modern look of the hotel works for me. KP

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: SPQ
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at Divan City last summer ( 2006). We've never stayed on this side of Istanbul so we realy didn't know what to expect. Divan City is located in the finance district in Istanbul so if you are looking for some cultural and historical places, you should look for a hotel in the old city of Istanbul., not Divan City. The hotel is very closed to the shopping malls, like Kanyon, Metro City, Akmerkez etc. Take a taxi and it will not cost more than 5-7 TRY. The Sisli metro station is about 5 minutes from the hotel by foot. From Sisli station to Taksim, it will take you another 10 minutes. The hotel has a very modern furnishing. Our room was on the 9th floor with a big nice bed. The room and the bath room was very clear. The hotel stuff was helpful and proffesional (I guess they have be when Divan City is a business hotel). The breakfast buffet was not the biggest one but very tasty. We can recommend Divan City for you guys who have been in Istanbul before and don't need to see all the historical places. Good value for your money. BR

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Chic and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: happyatif
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous review - a very cool and good value hotel for business or the more affluent tourist who will take taxis everywhere. Taxi to Sultanahmet and the historic sights will cost about 10YTL or Â£3-4. It is walking distance to the Profilo shopping centre - an ex fridge factory now a cool and trendy shopping mall. the location is not scenic or convenient unless you are a business man (my office was 5 minutes away in levent - the banking district). Make sure you dont get a room at the front of the hotel, other than that its a very well designed hotel, the reception is an all white designer boutique hotel type. (Much better than the more expensive Hilton parksa)

Reviews.Title: “A Swanky Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JerryinChicago
Reviews.Content: The elegant Divan City Hotel is located a bit off the beaten path for tourists in a business section of Istanbul. And indeed, most of the people I saw in the breakfast room every morning were men in business suits (I saw only one couple that looked like tourists and no children around the hotel at all). That said, the hotel is just around the corner from the Sisli Metro stop, which is just two stops from the hip Taksim part of Istanbul, so it's not out of the question for tourists as well. (The old city--Sultanahmet--is across the Golden Horn and best reached from here by taxi.) Rooms at the Divan City are quite chic--even the smallish standard room that I found online for only 70 Euros (about USD 84.00)--and the included breakfast is the best I've ever had in Istanbul (in fact, it's the best breakfast I've had at any hotel anywhere). Note that the hotel faces on a ten-lane main traffic artery AND an elevated expressway, so rooms away from the front (as mine was) may be quieter than those in the front, if not quite as bright.

HotelInfo.Name: Divan City Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Buyukdere Cad 84 | Gayrettepe, Istanbul 34398, Turkey
